title: 15 Min Yoga FULL BODY STRETCH & Deep Relaxation
description:
This is a 15 minute yoga full body stretch.
Doing this yin inspired yoga class will help to deeply stretch the entire body while releasing tension and promoting relaxation.
You can do this routine anytime of the day however it is a great addition to ones bedtime routine to help improve sleep.
This 15 min yoga stretch will also help to increase flexibility over time.
Remember to listen to the body and never do anything that causes pain or uncertain discomfort.

#Yoga #FullBodyStretch #WithMe

 & support.

ABOUT THIS YOUTUBE YOGA CHANNEL

Francine Cipollone also known as her childhood nickname Bird is a 200hr Certified Yoga Teacher who found a passion for helping others find inner peace, self love and happiness through the practice of Yoga & Meditation. She created this YouTube Yoga Channel to offer a space where yoga is accessible to all. This channel is all about feeling good and reconnecting to self. Yoga is for every-BODY, Join the journey by Subscribing today: https://www.youtube.com/yogawithbird

comments: JOIN My 2nd Channel for all things lifestyle 👉https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3_Ht5pCG7M1jKCnlwARhaQ

It's amazing how yoga can connect to your emotions. When in pigeon pose I started to cry. I'm getting married tomorrow and my Dad can't be there because he passed away in January. This big surge of emotion took over me in that posture and I thought of him and my tears dropped onto the mat. Yoga can be very healing, thank you Bird.

This felt so good. I’m only 20 but my muscles are horribly painful from being a full time early childcare worker as well as having just recovered from severe depression and sleep disorders that left me basically bedridden for years. The gentle reminders that it was ok to modify the poses so they didn’t heart made me feel so at peace and I’m hoping that this will become a daily ritual for me
This is so peaceful and comfortable, I felt like didn’t want to end the session.
Thank you for making this 15 minutes; it was much less intimidating than a longer video- for a beginner like me at least.
